means: 严重残害…的身体，使残缺不全，肢解( mutilate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: More than 30 horses have been mutilated in the last nine months.
sentence.Network_cn: 在过去9个月里，超过30匹马受了重伤。

sentence.Network_en: I dis-covered a mutilated cassette stuffed in a waste-basket.
sentence.Network_cn: 我发现一盘被弄坏的盒式磁带丢在废纸篓里。

sentence.Network_en: Brecht's verdict was that his screenplay had been mutilated.
sentence.Network_cn: 布雷赫特的结论是他的电影剧本已被窜改。

entry.tran: 使残缺不全;使受到严重损伤
entry.def: If a person or animal is mutilated, their body is severely damaged, usually by someone who physically attacks them.

example.ex: More than 30 horses have been mutilated in the last nine months...
example.tran: 在过去9个月里，超过30匹马受了重伤。

example.ex: He tortured and mutilated six young men...
example.tran: 他严刑拷问了6名年轻男子。

entry.def: If something is mutilated, it is deliberately damaged or spoiled.

example.ex: Brecht's verdict was that his screenplay had been mutilated...
example.tran: 布雷赫特的结论是他的电影剧本已被窜改。

example.ex: I discovered a mutilated cassette stuffed in a wastebasket.
example.tran: 我发现一盘被弄坏的盒式磁带丢在废纸篓里。

sentences.sentence: "the maimed right hand twisted and clutched"- P.B.Kyne

means.word_mean: 2. having a part of the body crippled or disabled
